results.title: 'Screen It' 2010 [winning entries]
results.brief_description:
‘Screen It’ was Australia’s national film, animation and game making competition for school-aged students, run by ACMI for 16 years to 2019.

Designed to encourage imagination and inventiveness in primary and secondary school students, ‘Screen It’ fostered a new generation of young media makers.

In 2010 students were asked to create works responding to the theme ‘The Environment: Who Cares?’.

Witness first-hand the amazing winning entries of the 2010 ‘Screen It’ competition!

results.title: Sell Yourself : Successful Job Interviewing
results.creator_credit: Kier M. Cline, Barbara Arrigo, Cinema Video Center and Learning Seed
results.brief_description: Going through a job interview is a nerve-racking experience for most of us. This video teaches you the skills needed to present yourself well and win a tough job interview. Over a dozen common interview situations are re-enacted in a dramatic and often humorous way to show you how not to proceed as well as how to impress your interviewer, from the moment you arrive to the moment the interview is closed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kier M. Cline, Barbara Arrigo, Cinema Video Center and Learning Seed

results.title: William Shakespeare's Hamlet [Widescreen] [Branagh]
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Branagh, David Barron and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: A massive all star cast brings to life this full text version of William Shakespeare’s Hamlet. With his usual brash exuberance and strong visual style Kenneth Branagh works hard to keep the pace rolling, integrating the acting styles of experienced Shakespearian theatre actors such as Judi Dench, Richard Briers and Derek Jacobi with an international movie star cast, including Gerard Depardieu, Charleton Heston, Richard Attenborough and Julie Christie. With an introductory ‘behind the scenes’ look at the making of the film, including an interview with Branagh.

results.title: William Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream
results.creator_credit: Michael Hoffman, Leslie Urdang, Fox Searchlight Pictures and Regency Enterprises
results.brief_description: A stellar cast headed by Michelle Pfeiffer and Kevin Kline, bring Shakespeare’s capering romantic comedy to life. When two pairs of star-crossed lovers, a feuding pair of supernatural sprites (Titania and Oberon), and a love potion gone awry all come together in an enchanted moonlit forest, the result is a delightful mix of merriment and magic. Cast also includes Calista Flockhart, Stanley Tucci and Rupert Everett.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Hoffman, Leslie Urdang, Fox Searchlight Pictures and Regency Enterprises

results.title: William S. Burroughs: commissioner of sewers
results.brief_description: Arguably Burroughs is the greatest talent to emerge from the “Beat” generation. In his novels, poetry, films and performance he has created an oppositional and profane aesthetic which continues to inspire contemporary artists and writers who refuse to - or cannot - work within the mainstream. This video features footage of Burroughs reading his poetry, excerpts from films by Gus van Sant, Antony Balch and Klaus Maeck, as well as a long interview where the writer explains his ideas on artistic inspiration; his belief that language is constituted as a virus; his use of “cut-up” and “fold- in” to represent contemporary experience of space and time; and the value of dreams for inspiration. Abrupt, unapologetic and disturbing this documentary reveals Burroughs as possessed of a profound intelligence, and as having the genius to translate his questioning and doubt into innovative and powerful art.

results.title: Turandot
results.creator_credit: Harold Prince, Rodney Greenberg and Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen
results.brief_description: Music by Giacomo Puccini with libretto by Giuseppe Adami and Renato Simoni, this made for television performance of “Turandot” was staged at the wonderfully atmospheric Vienna State Opera in 1983 under the exciting direction of Harold Prince (stage) and Rodney Greenberg (television). Set in Peking in legendary times, “Turandot” is a tale of drama, love and fantasy and of a Princess out to seek revenge on behalf of her ancestor Princess Lou-Ling who was brutally slain by a conquering prince. Turandot’s (Eva Marton) loathing and disdain for men brings about a proclamation that she will only become the bride of the royal suitor who can successfully answer three riddles. However, unsuccessful suitors will lose not only the hand of the princess, but also their heads. Enter a handsome young stranger by the name of Prince Calaf (Jose Carreras) who, although strongly discouraged by Turandot’s ministers, Ping (Robert Kerns), Pang (Helmut Wildhaber) and Pong (Heinz Zednik), is so overcome with Turandot’s beauty, that he offers himself as a new suitor. The story twists and turns until it reaches its tumultuous climactic end. Featuring stunning costumes in brilliant colors and spectacular stage sets, and supported by the Vienna State Opera Orchestra and Chorus conducted by world-renowned Lorin Maazel, this adaptation of “Turandot” is quite a visual experience. The internationally acclaimed lead singers each put in a magnificent performance and are strongly supported by Waldemar Kmentt (Altoum, Emperor of China), John Paul Bogart (Timur, vanquished King of Tartary) and Katia Ricciarelli (Liu the slave girl). Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Turn of the tide. The Man at the gate
results.creator_credit: Norman Walker, J. Arthur Rank, John Corfield, Lady Yule and British National Films GHW Productions
results.brief_description: Turn of the tide (80 min): This rarely seen British film, based on the novel ‘Three fevers’ by Leo Walmsley, was filmed on location at Robin Hood’s Bay and Whitby and tells the story of rivalry between two fishing families. It is set in the dramatically beautiful countryside of the Yorkshire coast. “The Man at the gate” (48 min): In 1940 Norman Walker put on his sea boots yet again and sent his location team down to Cornwall to shoot exteriors for a film which might have been regarded as a sequel. The story is centred around a fishing family, headed by Wilfrid Lawson.

results.title: Turn of the century
results.creator_credit: William Weintraub and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A glance at Canada’s yesteryears, at people and events, fashions and foibles at the end of the 19th century and the beginning of the 20th. From old photos and fragments of silent movies, this film pieces together a lively chronicle of what our elders like to call “the good old days.”

results.title: Turkey: the bridge
results.creator_credit: Derek Williams, British Petroleum and Samaratin Films
results.brief_description: Traces the history of Turkey - the land bridge between Europe and Asia. For more than 3,000 years the great events of these two continents centred on Turkey. The remains of the Greek civilisation, the crusades, and ancient Constantinople are contrasted with scenes of modern Istanbul.
